channel.title: Wildlife on Forest Garden Wales
channel.description: Recent content in Wildlife on Forest Garden Wales

item.title: Overview of my forest garden design process
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I’ve been asking friends and colleagues for feedback about what would make a good online course for forest gardening.

item.title: Wildlife: the power of a name
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Benjamin Vogt’s @BRVogt article Native Plants, Racism, & the Colonizing Nature of Garden Language is thought provoking stuff.

item.title: Biological recording workshop
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: West Wales Biodiversity Information Centre (WWBIC), made up of Pembrokeshire, Ceredigion & Carmarthen.

item.title: Wild Food Corridors
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: We need to protect and restore our wildlife whilst dramatically reducing our Greenhouse Gas emissions, which means sustainable food production on a global scale, something that can only happen with public awareness, understanding and support.

item.title: Bird nest box plan
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The whole point of a forest garden is that you are working with nature to grow edible crops.

item.title: Nest box
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The whole point of a forest garden is that you are working with nature to grow edible crops.
